fields.description:
Version Report graph does not show 100% completion when all Story Points are Done. For example, from the default generated Sample Scrum Project:
!default sample scrum project.png|thumbnail!
* The version has 8 out of 8 story points complete.

The Graph accurate depicts the Story Point axis on the left with 8 Story Points complete, but the Percentage is incorrect. The Percent axis on the right shows 90%, where 100% would be expected.

I've run multiple tests with different versions and projects and the results are the same, where the percentage does not reach 100%.

Steps to reproduce:
* Generate the Sample Scrum Board for JIRA Agile
* Navigate to Version Reports
* Check the different versions and observe the graphs
* Compare to the list of issues, notice that all stories are complete, but the graph never reaches 100%
fields.summary: Version Report Does not 100% when all Stories are Done

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently there is no way to configure or adjust the scope change requirement. Therefore any modification after the sprint has started, it consider as scope change.
h3. Suggested Solution
It should have some configuration or settings to define the scope change requirement.

h3. Example of customer requirement/scenario:
{quote}
As described below we follow a development model which is based on Agile with a few modifications.
we follow a 22 day sprint, where the first day is used for Walkthroughs and the second day for Sprint Planning and only on that day would our Managers upload the plan on JIRA and start the sprint.

The Problem we are facing is that since the Original Start date of the sprint is Day1 and we do the planning and start the sprint on Day 2 mentioning the sprint start date as Day 1 all the requirements added to the sprint on day two are considered as scope change.
JIRA here is considering the Date we specify as Sprint Start date to check for Scope changes  and it is not considering the system time when a sprint is actually started on JIRA for the same. 

our opinion is that JIRA should not consider all the requirements added to JIRA prior to Sprint Start on JIRA as scope change and should consider only issues that are added post the Sprint Start event on JIRA as scope change.
{quote}
fields.summary: scope change configuration

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using German language in JIRA, the *days is column* in kanban board is not showing the remaining days
h3. Environment
* JIRA 6.4.7
* JIRA Agile 6.7.7

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a kanban board
# Switch the language to German in General Configuration of JIRA

h3. Expected Results
The correct value of remaining days should be shown
h3. Actual Results
Only the Text *in dieser Spalte* is being shown
 
h3. Notes
Basically, this bug behaviour is regression from https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-10129
h3.Workaround
Switch to English language in JIRA
fields.summary: Kanban board "days in column" not working in German language

Hi,
In our active sprint we see that issues with subtask are always placed higher than issues without subtasks. Although we prioritized them in a different way in the backlogscreen.

fields.description:
h3. Description

User would like to choose whether the issues (that weren't done in the Sprint that was closed) go to the next Future Sprint or go back to the Backlog.

h3. How it is

# Create a Board and 2 sprints
# Fill the first Sprint with a couple of tickets and start it
# Complete some issues (not all) and complete the sprint
# The issues that weren't done during the Sprint will be automatically put to the next Sprint

h3. How the user would like it to be

The user should be able to configure if he wants the following behaviour:

# Create a Board and 2 sprints
# Fill the first Sprint with a couple of tickets and start it
# Complete some issues (not all) and complete the sprint
# The issues that weren't done during the Sprint will be automatically put to the next Sprint

*Or this behaviour*:

# Create a Board and 2 sprints
# Fill the first Sprint with a couple of tickets and start it
# Complete some issues (not all) and complete the sprint
# The issues that weren't done during the Sprint will be automatically put back to the backlog
fields.summary: Completing sprints moves all issues that weren't done to the next future sprint

fields.description:
h2. Symptom

'Technical Task' issue type and 'JIRA Agile Scrum Issue Type Scheme' issue type scheme are not created at installation time, although the [JIRA Agile - JIRA Configuration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/JIRA+Agile+-+JIRA+Configuration] describes as follows:
{quote}
h5. Issue types
At installation time, JIRA Agile will create the following three JIRA issue types and associate them with the Default Issue Type Scheme:
- 'Epic'
- 'Story'
- 'Technical Task' (sub-task)

h5. Issue type scheme
At installation time, JIRA Agile will create a new issue type scheme called 'JIRA Agile Scrum Issue Type Scheme' which contains the following issue types:
- 'Bug'
- 'Epic'
- 'Improvement'
- 'Story'
- 'Technical Task' (sub-task)
{quote}



h2. Findings
- When using JIRA 6.3.x, the issue type and issue type scheme are not created
- When using JIRA 6.4.x, the issue type is not created but issue type scheme is created after creating the first Scrum/Kanban project



h2. Workaround (if JIRA Agile version is earlier than 6.7.0)
They are created when you:
# Install JIRA Agile
# Go to *JIRA Administration > Add-ons > Project Template*
# Select *Scrum* at *Project Templates* section.
fields.summary: Issue type and issue type scheme for Agile are not created at installation time

Qualcomm SUpport

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Ranking operations are taking a huge delay in Microsoft SQL 2012, when executed in huge instances (reproduced in an instance with more than 1.500.000 issues). 
Due to the delay, the ranking operation times out and fails very frequently. The message below is displayed in the UI:
_"JIRA Agile cannot execute the rank operation at this time. Other users may be ranking the issues that you are trying to rank. Please try again later"_

h3. Environment
* Tested with Microsoft SQL 2008 and 2012
* JIRA Agile 6.6.80
* 1.500.000 issues

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a JIRA Instance connected with MSSQL, generate at least 1.000.000 issues
# Create a test board and add some hundred of issues to its backlog
# Try to rank the issues
# This can be reproduced by either ranking a single issue, or ranking multiple issues at the same time

h3. Expected Results
The issues should be ranked successfully

h3. Actual Results
The following error will be thrown:
!rankingerror.png|thunbnail!
 
Sometimes it appears that the operation worked, but *after refreshing the page the issues are back to their original position in the backlog.* 

h3.Workaround
When affected by this issue, there is one change that have to be implemented to actually workaround this problem:
h5. 1 - Add {{sendStringParametersAsUnicode=false}} to the JDBC connection string
# Open the {{$[JIRA_HOME|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Home+Directory]/dbconfig.xml}} file
# Append the following option the connection string *;sendStringParametersAsUnicode=false* to the *jdbc-datasource/url* tag value
#* Connection string will look like the following (url might have extra parameters at the end): 
{code}
jdbc:jtds:sqlserver://<SERVER_URL>:<SERVER_PORT>/<DB_NAME>;sendStringParametersAsUnicode=false
{code}
# Restart JIRA
fields.summary: JIRA Agile performs slowly when using Microsoft SQL Server

fields.description:
h3. Description
Cumulative Flow Diagram does not respect the Base Swimlanes defined in Board management. 
When Base Swimlanes are configured for Assignees, Stories or Epics, those swimlanes should be present there. 

Additionally, this is not reproducible when Base Swimlanes are configured to use "Queries", since this is possible to properly filter them on CFD.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a board containing several issues assigned to different people.
# Go to board Configuration > Swimlanes
# Set "Base Swimlanes on" to "Assignees"
# Check the board to confirm that swimlanes by assignee were properly set.
# Go to Reports > Cumulative Flow Diagram
# Click Refine Report. There is a Swimlane section, however it shows only swimlanes based on queries.
fields.summary: Cumulative Flow Diagram allow only Swimlane filters based on queries

fields.description:
h4. +Scenario+
Using a Simplified Workflow, a Board-Project Admin can add a new status or remove an existing one if it does not contain any issues. However, it's not easy to change the Initial Status to a new one from Board Configuration. Example:
* The workflow originally contains To Do, In Progress, and Done, in which To Do is the Initial Status of every newly created issue
* A new status is added called New and the Board-Project Admin (which is not a JIRA admin) would like it to become the Initial Status instead of To Do
* He can't edit the workflow from JIRA Administration

h4. +Suggestion+
There should be an easy way for the Board-Project Admin to set a newly added status as the Initial Status, similar to marking which status has Resolution set.

h4. +Workaround+
Assume that there're now New, To Do, In Progress, and Done available, in which To Do is the Initial Status and the Board-Project Admin would like to set it to New:
# transition all issues from To Do to New
# add New to the leftmost column and move it to the top of the column
# drag To Do to Unmapped Statuses and remove it
(i) JIRA Agile prompts to replace To Do with New as the Initial Status:
!switch.png|thumbnail!
# click Remove
# to get To Do back, click Add Status and select it from the list of Existing Statuses
# drag To Do to an appropriate column

(/) New will still be the Initial Column
fields.summary: Allow Board-Project Admin to change the Initial Status of a Simplified workflow

h4.Problem statement
 
The Agile 6.6.41 is disabled after the license expired. This behaviour only replicable in Agile 6.6.41. The same behaviour is *not* reproducible with Agile 6.7.4 using the same license

h4.Expected behavior

Agile plugin should not disabled after license expired, as long as the Agile version was released before the license expiry date

h4.Steps to reproduce 
# Install JIRA (any version) + Agile (6.6.41)
# Install the expired license at June 26, 2015 
# Noticed the Agile plugin is disabled
!expired.png|thumbnail!

h4.Remediation

# If your license is valid after 2015-06-03, upgrade JIRA Agile to 6.7.3 (note the classic board is removed in this version and above)
# If your license is expired before that date, generate a 30 days evaluation license by going through https://my.atlassian.com

If you are not sure, please raise a support ticket through support.atlassian.com
fields.summary: Agile plugin 6.6.41 is disabled after license expired

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When restoring JIRA Cloud backup to JIRA 6.4.5 and JIRA Agile 6.7.4, the following error message was shown in the UI.
!ja.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Setup JIRA 6.4.5 with JIRA Agile 6.7.4
# Restore the Cloud Backup

h3. Expected Result
The data is restored and Agile is working

h3. Actual Result
JIRA Agile is not working, the below error is thrown
!ja.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
# Stop JIRA
# Reset the upgrade tasks for JIRA Agile plugin to number 47, which is the task BEFORE version 6.7.5:
{code}
UPDATE propertynumber SET propertyvalue = 47
WHERE id = (SELECT id FROM propertyentry WHERE property_key = 'GreenHopper.Upgrade.Latest.Upgraded.Version');
UPDATE propertystring SET propertyvalue = '47'
WHERE id = (SELECT id FROM propertyentry WHERE property_key = 'com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:build');
{code}
# Restart JIRA

(!) Kindly remember to generate JIRA Backup before performing any changes in the database
fields.summary: JIRA Agile is currently unavailable error when Restoring the JIRA Cloud backup to JIRA 6.4.5 with JIRA Agile 6.7.4

When attempting to move a ticket with an Epic associated with it, to the top or bottom of a swimlane, all Epic associations in that swimlane disappear temporarily. 2. Right click on one of these tickets, and select *Send to* "Top of Swimlane" or "Bottom of Swimlane".

fields.description:
We strictly use Fibonacci story point values by the book. When the development team is working on an issue we encourage them to break it down into smaller pieces for their work and to give a more granular burn-down but without impacting the committed-to volume of the agreed whole. Presently the clone function is used for this but then further tweaking is required to adjust the story points of the clones and original issue. This causes some noise on the burndown chart and in the respective reports this looks like lots of scope change events but it isn't - it's scope neutral. Also the clones don't inherit the original's workflow state of, in our case, "commissioned".
We would very much appreciate the possibility of a "split" function, which would provide a dialog box to enter a summary for each of the new issues, inclusive of the original. It should also be possible to enter directly in that dialog the Story Points which each of the new issues, including the original, should have. This must total the same as the story points of the original. On pressing OK, the new issues would be created and the original adjusted in its summary and story point value. All issues created should automatically have the same state and assignee (as well as other meta data such as components, labels, sprint etc.) as the original did prior to the split. All of this should be registered as a single split action on the reports and be completely invisible on the burndown chart.
fields.summary: Split an issue and its story points into parts whilst maintaining state

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Customer has updated usernames for all users within their Cloud environment. User Management displays the new usernames. Customer then looks at Agile Boards and clicks on the owner of a board. The user receives an error that the username does not exist.

h3. Environment
Cloud 
Possibly Server 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Create a user with an email address for the username
Create an Agile Board with the new user
Change the username by removing the @emaildomain from the username
Go to the {{All Boards}} page and click on the username

h3. Expected Results
Correct information should be displayed

h3. Actual Results
Error is received
{noformat}
The specified user could not be found
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
It is possible to update the A0 table that holds this information.

You will need to query the A0 table that holds rapid view information: Example: AO_60DB71_RAPIDVIEW 
***NOTE: This may be different in a customers instance

***NOTE: Updating the AO table did not resolve this. A full lock and reindex was run after changing one of the users.
fields.summary: Agile Board owner points to incorrect username after username is changed

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA projects using Epic Links without Agile subscription enabled are unable to add Epic links to issues, add issues to Epics, or remove Epic links from current issues.

h3. Environment
JIRA 6.5-OD-07
JIRA Agile 6.7.6

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Project > Select Project Type > JIRA Default Schemes.
# In the new project, create an Epic.
# On the new Epic, click + under *Issues in Epic*
# Create a new issue, change type from Epic to Task.
# Save. You will notice that it has not been added to the Epic.


h3. Expected Results
* On an instance with Agile subscription, or previous to this update, you would be able to add Epic Links:
!Screen Shot 2015-06-22 at 5.15.26 PM.png!
* Additionally, from the issue view, you would be able to add an issue to an Epic right from that screen when cicking + sign.
* Lastly, you would have been able to clear the Epic Link field and remove the link.

h3. Actual Results
* View the task you created in *Steps to Reproduce*, and click *Edit*. Scroll down to *Epic Link* and you will see there's no way to add an Epic Link.

!Screen Shot 2015-06-22 at 5.15.46 PM.png!

 
h3. Notes
* See screenshots for comparison of the code when an instance is working vs. not working.
* This does work in releases prior to this release.

h3.Workaround
Start a trial of JIRA Agile
fields.summary: Users with no Agile subscription unable to add or edit Epic links

fields.description:
*Bug Description*
After closing a sprint, we noticed that the sprint velocity calculation is incorrect. The "completed issues" section shows issues that seem to have no value for the story point field. However clicking on the issue shows that there was indeed a story point value set for the issue. The problem seems to be cause by the fact that the value was added right before the issue was resolved. 

*Repro steps*
1. Create a New sprint
2. create an issue and don't add story points
3.  Add issue to the sprint
4. Open the issue, and edit the story points of the issue = 2
5. Move the issue through workflow, until completion
6. close sprint, and look at sprint story point
fields.summary: Sprint velocity doesn't account for issues with story point changes

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When issues are moved to a planned Sprint, and then transitioned to Done while still on the planned sprint board, the issues will not be visible.

Only when they Sprint is started will the Issues in Done status be visible again.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new board & project using Agile Simplified Workflow
# Configure the board to use Estimation:
## Estimation Statistic : Original Time Estimate
## Time Tracking : Remaining Estimate and Time Spent
# Add 3 issues to the board each with 10 hours Estimate & Remaining time
!sprint1.png|thumbnail!
# Open 1 or 2  issues in a new tab and transition the issue to *Done*
!sprint2.png|thumbnail!
!sprint3.png|thumbnail!
# Go back to the Board Backlog & Refresh the page. Notice that the issues that was transitioned to Done is now missing from the board.
!sprint4.png|thumbnail!
# Start the sprint now those issues that were transitioned to *Done* and which were missing earlier are now visible both in the Active Sprint Board & Backlog.
!sprint5.png|thumbnail!
!sprint6.png|thumbnail!


h3. Expected Results
Issues that are transitioned to Done on the planned sprint ( backlog ) should be visible

h3. Actual Results
Issues that are transitioned to Done on the planned sprint ( backlog ) is hidden until Sprint is started
fields.summary: Issues transitioned to Done status on planned sprint are not visible until sprint is started

fields.description:
Using J/K to navigate cards provides them with an explicit focused style, but it isn't actually shifting focus. This means screen readers are not provided with any feedback.

Suggested fix is to apply tabindex="-1" to each card, or alternatively make each column a separate tab target with tabindex="0", and use aria-activedescendant to manage the focus of items within each column. The first option is probably the simplest and would perform more consistently across different browser/screen reader combinations.
fields.summary: Using J/K to navigate cards in JIRA Software Active Sprints/Kanban board doesn't announce to screen readers

Create two scrum projects (A and B). Each will get a scrum board.
In each scrum board, create a sprint (with different names, for example Sprint A1, and Sprint B1).
Create a new issue for project A but assign it to Sprint B1.
Jira does not complain, however when the user clicks on "view on board" in the details of the issue, a popup is shown indicating that the issue can be seen in Sprint B1 in different boards, for project A and B.
However the Sprint is not visible in project A, and the sprint in project B will not show the issue. Thus the issue is not vissible in any board.

I think it is not correct to let the issue be assigned to a sprint it won't be vissible in.

The user assumed typing out the JQL and clicking save would do the trick. They did not execute the search and accidentally made a filter for every issue.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As a configurer of an Agile board, similar to how I can configure my custom issue statuses to belong to one of the three options, I would also like to configure the columns on my agile board to be:
- {color:#205081}Not Started{color}
- {color:#f6c342}In Progress{color}
- {color:#8eb021}Done{color}

Currently the automatic assumption is that the very left column is {color:#205081}Not Started{color} and the very right column is {color:#8eb021}Done{color}.

This is a huge limitation in Jira Agile and causes problems especially with rendering the burndown chart.

I do not believe that asking the user to merge multiple of my columns into one or to create a separate Agile board is a sufficient solution for the issue.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the ability to add additional columns to also represent *Not Started* and *Done* in addition to the ability to already add an *In Progress* column.
 
h3. Note
Judging from the comments on GHS-10261 and GHS-11355 as well as [this post|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/218653/configuring-jira-agile-columns-for-notstarted-inprogress-and-done] on Atlassian Answers, I do feel that this is a feature of general interest.

Please stop closing every suggestion about this as "Answered" and leave any one of these three open for us to vote on.

Note: I am explicitly filing a duplicate of GHS-10261 and GHS-11355, both of which I find to have been closed prematurely.
fields.summary: In Configure Board, allow multiple "Not Started" (Blue) and "Done" (Green) columns

fields.description:
On a Project Backlog the option to "Create Epic" inside the Epics tab, doesn't create an Epic so the issue created doesn't show on the Epics tab.

*Cause:*
The Project doesn't contain an Epic Issue Type.

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create a new "Simple Issue Tracking" project
# Create a Scrum Board from that project
# Go to the Backlog of the new Scrum Board
# Expand the Epics section
# Click "Create epic"

*Expected:* Epic Issue Type is available
*Actual Result:* Epic Issue Type is not available so the Create Epic option actually creates a different Issue Type.

*Notes*
This can be confusing. Epics created doing this are not actually Epics so they don't appear on the Epics section.
Maybe a warning about the unavailability of the Epic Issue Type would clear things out.

*Workaround alternatives:*
a) If it is a new project, delete it and create it again from *Agile -> Manage Boards -> Create board ->  Create Scrum Board -> New project and a new board*
b) Create a *New project and a new board* from the Agile menu and then move issues to the new project. You may use [Bulk Move|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Modifying+Multiple+(Bulk)+Issues]
c) Add the Epic Issue Type to the Issue Type Scheme or switch the Issue Type Scheme to the Scrum default one.
fields.summary: "Create Epic" option creates other Issue Types if Epic is not available on Project.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When upgrading JIRA and JIRA Agile from older versions to the latest versions of both, the issues<>sprint associations for future sprints - previously known as Sprint Markers - loses data, and after the upgrade issues no longer are displayed.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 6.0.8
* JIRA Agile 6.2.5.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA 6.0.8
# Install JIRA Agile 6.2.5.1 from https://marketplace.atlassian.com/download/plugins/com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira/versions
# Create a project;
# Create a board;
# Create some sprints in this board;
# Create some issues;
# Put those issues inside the future sprints.
# Stop JIRA;
# Install JIRA 6.4.x and point it to the previously used JIRA Home.
# Start JIRA 6.4.x;
# Update JIRA Agile to the latest version.
# Select Agile > "Your Board"

h3. Expected Results
After following those steps and accessing the board, the issues would be displayed correctly in their respective sprints.

h3. Actual Results
All issues are shown in the backlog, even after re-indexing JIRA.
 
h3. Notes
You can download the backup attached ([^matheus.zip]) and use the credentials matheus/matheus to replicate this. Just restore on 6.0.8 and upgrade it following the steps described above.

h3.Workaround
* Update JIRA Agile to the latest version available (JIRA Agile 6.3.x) prior to upgrading JIRA. 
* If JIRA has already been upgraded:
*# create a test instance with the JIRA backup on your {{[$JIRA-Home|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Home+Directory]/export}} directory using the previous version of JIRA you were using.
*# Update JIRA Agile to the latest available version.
*# Then, upgrade JIRA to the same version as you are using.
*# Update JIRA Agile to the same version as you are using.
*# Use the following SQL Query to identify which Boards/Sprints/Issues were affected:
{code:SQL| borderStyle=solid| borderColor=#6A8EB3 |bgColor=#F8F8F8}
SELECT  board."NAME",
        sprint."NAME",
        CONCAT(p.pkey,CONCAT('-',ji.issuenum)) AS "IssueKey"
FROM "AO_60DB71_SPRINT" sprint 
    INNER JOIN "AO_60DB71_RAPIDVIEW" board ON sprint."RAPID_VIEW_ID" = board."ID"
    INNER JOIN customfield cf ON cf.cfname = 'Sprint'
    INNER JOIN customfieldvalue cfv ON CAST(cfv.stringvalue as INTEGER) = sprint."ID" AND cfv.customfield = cf.id
    INNER JOIN jiraissue ji ON ji.id = cfv.issue
    INNER JOIN project p ON p.id = ji.project
WHERE sprint."RAPID_VIEW_ID" IS NOT NULL 
ORDER BY 1;
{code}
fields.summary: When upgrading JIRA Agile from 6.2.x to latest directly the sprint markers migration doesn't work correctly.

fields.description:
h3. *Current Behavior*
* If you have an agile board open in one browser tab and open another agile board/project in different browser tab, returning to the first opened agile board and clicking *Create Issue* results in the default/selected value of a project to be from the second opened agile board/project. It defaults the project to the last viewed project. 

Example:
* 1. Open a Scrum board (ex: SUPPORT BOARD that filters issues from a project called SUPPORT (SUPP))
* 2. In another browser tab, open up an issues from a different project (ex: PROD-205)
* 3. Switch back to the tab containing the Scrum board.
* 4. Click Create and the Create Issue screen now contains the default/selected value of PRODUCTION (PROD)

* *Only thing that resolves this is by refreshing current page*

h3. *Tested In*
* {{JIRA v6.5-OD-05-041}} in {{Chrome Version 42.0.2311.135 (64-bit)}},{{Safari Version 8.0.6 (10600.6.3)}}, and {{Firefox 38.0.5}}

h3. *Suggestion*

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Have projects with sprints
# Have Sprints that share some text (e.g. Sprint 1, QA Sprint 1, etc.)
# Run the search:
{{Project = X and Sprint = "Sprint 1"}}

*Expected Results:*
# The search result should return only issues that have "Sprint 1" set.

*Actual Results:*
# The search result is returning issues that contain that text on it (issues set with "Sprint 1" and "QA Sprint 1")

*Workaround:*
# Use the sprint search by ID instead of name. E.g.:
{{Project = X and Sprint = 123}}

*Notes:*
According to the [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+Searching#AdvancedSearching-operator]...
bq. The "=" operator is used to search for issues where the value of the specified field *exactly matches* the specified value.
The Sprint field does not allow the "~" operator.
fields.summary: JQL Search for specific match on Sprint field

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: On Agile boards in Plan mode, there is a slider to resize the detail view.  This is not available in Work mode, in either Agile or Kanban view.  I understand that in most cases, having a lot of columns in Work mode means this wouldn't be helpful, but we have several use cases, including kanban boards with only one or two columns, where this would be very helpful.  Please add this ability, even if there is some limitation based on number of columns to what the maximum size might be.
fields.summary: Add Resize Detail View slider to Work mode
